1900540.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900540
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 001
1900540.text: Umm ul Mu'mineen Umm Salama said: "The apparel dearest to Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) was the shirt [qamis].”

1900550.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900550
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 002
1900550.text: Umm Salama said: "The apparel dearest to Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) was the shirt.”

1900560.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900560
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 003
1900560.text: Umm Salama said: "The apparel dearest to Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) was the shirt he used to wear.”

1900570.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900570
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 004
1900570.text: Asma bint Yazid said: “The sleeve of the shirt of Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) extended to the wrist.”

1900580.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900580
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 005
1900580.text: Mu'awiya ibn Qurra reported that his father said: “I came to Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) in a group of fewer than ten men from the Muzaina tribe, so that we might pay homage to him, and his shirt was set loose (or: “the button of his shirt was set loose”), so I inserted my hand in the breast of his shirt and I touched the Seal.”

1900590.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900590
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 006
1900590.text: Anas ibn Malik said: "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) came out leaning on Usama ibn Zaid, wearing an outer garment of coarse cotton fabric, which he had thrown on loosely, then he led them in the ritual prayer.”

1900600.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900600
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 007
1900600.text: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri said: "When Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) donned a new garment, he would call it by its name, then he would say: 'O Allah praise be to You, as You have clothed me with it! I beg You for its goodness and the goodness of what it has been made for, and I take refuge with You from its evil and the evil of what it has been made for!’”

1900620.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900620
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 008
1900620.text: Anas ibn Malik said: “The apparel dearest to Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) was the hibara [striped garment of Yemenite fabric] that he used to wear.”

1900630.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900630
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 009
1900630.text: Awn ibn Abi Juhaifa said that his father said: “I saw the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) wearing a red garb, as if I were looking at the sheen of his legs.” Sufyan said: “I think it was a hibara [striped garment of Yemenite fabric].”

1900640.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900640
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 010
1900640.text: Al-Bara’ ibn ‘Azib said: "I never saw anyone among the people more handsome in a red garb than Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace), when the hair of his head was touching close to his shoulders.”

1900650.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900650
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 011
1900650.text: Abu Rimtha said: “I saw the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) wearing two green garments."

1900660.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900660
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 012
1900660.text: Qaila bint Makhrama said: “I saw the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) wearing the tatters of two sheets which had been dyed with saffron, but had lost their color....” (This tradition is part of a longer story.)

1900670.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900670
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 013
1900670.text: Ibn 'Abbas said: Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): “You should acquire white clothes, so that your living ones may wear them, and you can shroud your deceased in them, for they are among the best of your clothes.”

1900680.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900680
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 014
1900680.text: Samura ibn Jundub said: “Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): 'Wear white, for it is most pure and pleasant, and you must shroud your deceased therein'.”

1900690.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900690
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 015
1900690.text: 'Aisha said; “Allah's Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) went out one early morning, wearing a wrap of black hair.”

1900700.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900700
In-book reference  : Book 8, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 8, Hadith 016
1900700.text: Urwa ibn al-Mughira ibn Shu'ba said that his father said: “The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) wore a Byzantine robe with narrow sleeves.”
